lccdd.comment:
Master tracker parameters
Central Tracking region consists of: |----------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | OuterBarrel | | | |--------------------------------------------------------| | | | | MedialBarrel | | | | | |------------------------------------| | | | | | | InnerBarrel | | | | | | | |----------------| | | | | Outer | Medial | Inner | Vertex Tracker | Inner | Medial | Outer | | EndcapN | EndcapN | EndcapN | Vertex Tracker | EndcapP | EndcapP | EndcapP | |----------------------------------------------------------------------------| ^ ^ CentralTrackingRegionN_zmax CentralTrackingRegionP_zmax

define.comment: Gem disk setup. Note: some GEM disk z-positions are moved slightly (below in the parametrization) to avoid vertical overlaps with the silicon disks (which is not allowed by ACTS). @FIXME
Account for the fact that GEMs have holes, so they are not solid volumes

lccdd.documentation:
## Inner silicon tracker barrel ### Silicon Tracker
#### Some references:
- With some added info on ITS3 chip from https://indico.bnl.gov/event/10677/contributions/45591/attachments/33204/53254/20210318-IR2%40EIC-SVT.pdf To be used as standin until we get more detailed specs from the working group on the tracker. - https://wiki.bnl.gov/athena/index.php/Tracking
#### ITS3 sensors
ITS3 sensor thickness: - 40um, pixel size: 10um (segmentation) - total X0 0.55% per barrel layer: - 0.35 mm aluminum ~ 0.4% X0. - 2 x carbonfiber (RL ~ 28) 0.12 mm (!!! material scan shows ~0.17mm, need to check later) to match Si (RL~9) of 0.04mm ~ 0.04%
total X0 0.24% per disk layer ï¼ˆ4 sectors per disk): - 0.15 mm aluminum ~ 0.16% X0. - 1 x carbonfiber (RL ~ 28) 0.12 mm to match Si (RL~9) of 0.04mm ~ 0.04%

define.comment: Shorten Module (with non-zero thickness!) to avoid overlaps with support cone
Place asymmetrically in the layer (module sits near the bottom).

lccdd.documentation: ## Inner silicon tracker disks, symmetric between N and P

define.comment: The tracker endcap ends at the same place as the medial tracker barrel that sits around it

constant.name: MMTrackerBarrelMod_thickness
constant.value: MMKaptonOverlay_thickness + MMCuGround_thickness + MMPCB_thickness + MMCuStrip_thickness + MMKaptonStrip_thickness + MMResistiveStrip_thickness + MMGas_thickness + MMMesh_thickness + MMGasGap_thickness + MMDriftCuElectrode_thickness + MMDriftKapton_thickness + MMDriftCuGround_thickness

define.comment: The value of InnerTrackerEndcap_zmax is calculated above based on the rmin of the MedialTrackerBarrel

module.name: MedialTrackerBarrel_Mod1
module.comment: Going from the inside (sensitive) side to the readout side

module.name: MedialTrackerBarrel_Mod2
module.comment: Going from the inside (sensitive) side to the readout side

lccdd.documentation: ## Medial silicon tracker disks (1 each), symmetric between N and P except for disk rmin

define.comment: The tracker endcap ends at the same place as the outer tracker barrel that sits around it
The value of MedialTrackerEndcap_zmax is calculated above based on the rmin of the OuterTrackerBarrel

module.name: OuterTrackerBarrel_Mod1
module.comment: Going from the inside (sensitive) side to the readout side

module.name: OuterTrackerBarrel_Mod2
module.comment: Going from the inside (sensitive) side to the readout side

define.comment: The Si tracker endcap ends at position of the last disk
The Si tracker endcap ends at position of the last disk

constant.name: GEMEndcapMod_thickness
constant.value: GEMMylar_thickness * 2 + GEMGas_thickness * 5 + GEMDriftRegion_thickness * 1 + GEMKapton_thickness * (2 + 3 * GEMAreaFactor) + GEMCuFoil_thickness * (3 * GEMAreaFactor) + GEMCuElectrode_thickness * 2

define.comment: Parameters for the "ring" GEMS around the silicon tracker, which are all identical
z position of the "ring" GEMS, note that some are offset slightly to not overlap in z with the silicon disks (an ACTS limitation).
Ensure there's always the length of the service gap in space available above the large GEM (top frame can extend into this at the corners).
